title: PROFESSOR MOSQUITO

sections.content: With over 35 years of Capoeira experience, Jackson Ferreira, known as Professor Mosquito, is a highly skilled and dedicated teacher in the ABADÁ-Capoeira community. His expertise spans a wide range of teaching methods, performances, and cultural education.

teaching.title: Teaching Expertise
items: Specializes in classes for youth and adults of all abilities
Has over 15 years of experience teaching children with special needs, creating inclusive and engaging learning environments
Developed and led after-school programs for over 15 years, focusing on discipline, fitness, and cultural awareness through Capoeira

performance.title: Performance and Percussion
items: Over 20 years of experience in Capoeira performances, showcasing the art's dynamic blend of martial arts, dance, and music
Expert in traditional Capoeira percussion, enriching his classes with authentic rhythms and cultural depth

global.title: Global Experience
items: Has traveled extensively around the world to both teach and learn Capoeira under the guidance of some of the most renowned ABADÁ-Capoeira masters, expanding his knowledge and refining his skills

closing: Professor Mosquito's dedication to Capoeira extends beyond the roda — his commitment to fostering community, empowering students, and preserving Capoeira's rich heritage makes him a respected and influential figure in the ABADÁ-Capoeira family.
